p: Similar observations could be made for the IL-pretreated samples, with the glucan content significantly decreasing only after 15 h (from 44 to 33%), while hemicelluloses content remained unchanged. Interestingly, the relative lignin content remained similar during the first 15 h of reaction ( p = 0.072), whereas most of the glucose was released from the samples during this time (Fig. 1). This removal of lignin during the first 15 h of saccharification could be a consequence of some modifications of the lignin features. Previous analyses showed that the S/G ratio of poplar samples increased after IL pretreatment while the G units content decreased [ 13]. A relatively higher proportion of S units could make lignin more prone to partial degradation under the mild conditions of enzymatic hydrolysis, as S units are more likely to establish labile β- O-4′ linkages due to the steric hindrance of the methoxy groups on the aryl moieties [ 37].
